p.codeblock: public abstract int CreateDataStreamEx(ref int streamId, bool reliable, bool ordered, RtcConnection connection);

dlentry.dd: Deprecated: This method is deprecated. Use instead.

section.p: You can call this method to create a data stream and improve the reliability and ordering of data transmission.
section.note: During the lifecycle of , each user can create up to 5 data streams. The data streams are destroyed when leaving the channel. To use them again, you need to recreate the data streams.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called after .

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: When reliable is set to , if the receiver does not receive the data sent by the sender within 5 seconds, the callback is triggered and the corresponding error message is returned.

plentry.pd: Output parameter. The ID of the created data stream.

pd.note: Make sure to set reliable and ordered both to or both to .
pd.ph: Whether to guarantee data reliability, i.e., whether the receiver must receive the data within 5 seconds after it is sent:

ul.li: : The receiver will receive the data sent by the sender within 5 seconds, otherwise the callback is triggered and the corresponding error message is returned.
: The receiver is not guaranteed to receive the data, and no error is reported even if the data is lost.

plentry.pd:
Whether to guarantee data ordering, i.e., whether the receiver must receive the data in the order it was sent:
: The receiver receives the data packets in the order they were sent by the sender.
: The receiver is not guaranteed to receive the data packets in order.

ul.li: < 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
